benchmark_details.name: FingerTip
benchmark_details.overview: The FingerTip benchmark evaluates the proactive and personalized capabilities of mobile GUI agents through two tracks: proactive task suggestions based on environmental observations and user intents, and personalized task execution according to user action preferences.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To advance mobile GUI agents towards proactive task suggestion and personalized task execution.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: The data collected is primarily from users in mainland China, which may not generalize to other regions. The study also highlights challenges related to data privacy and potential re-identification of users.

data.source: User data collected through the FingerTip application
data.annotation: Users provided demonstrations of interactions with Android apps based on real scenarios.

methodology.calculation: Success rates are calculated based on whether the predicted user intents match the actual intents. Similarity scores are computed using cosine similarity for text and Levenshtein distance for action sequences.
methodology.interpretation: Higher success rates and similarity scores indicate better predictive accuracy of user intents and personalization of task execution.
methodology.validation: The benchmark was validated using a train-validation-test split of the collected data.

targeted_risks.demographic_analysis: The benchmark includes demographic information from users, which is analyzed to understand differences in action sequences among different groups.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: User data is anonymized, but there is a risk of re-identification due to unique patterns in interaction.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.consent_procedures: Participants signed a data usage agreement and were informed about data usage expectations.
